intro: Ocimum comigerum, commonly known as Indian basil or holy basil, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to India. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, pale purple flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a strong, spicy aroma due to the presence of essential oils. Ocimum comigerum is widely used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb.
